description: From Middle English afeld, a-felde, o felde, on felde, from Old English on felde (“afield”, literally “in (the) field”), equivalent to a- (“on”) +‎ field.

adverbs.description: afield (comparative more afield, superlative most afield)

entries.meaning: Away (from the home or starting point, physical or conceptual); usually preceded by far (or farther, further).

examples: We now have both teams afield and can begin the match.
